snippet: Millions of dependents may suffer because of the I.R.S.’s needlessly strict reading of the health care law.
abstract: Editorial expresses disappointment at Internal Revenue Service's ruling on how to calculate affordability of health insurance offered by employers, which could leave millions of Americans with modest incomes unable to afford family coverage under their employers' health insurance and ineligible for subsidies to buy coverage elsewhere; notes that ruling stems from needlessly strict interpretation of Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: Millions of dependents may suffer because of the I.R.S.’s needlessly strict reading of the health care law.

headline.seo: A Cruel Blow to American Families
headline.main: A Cruel Blow to American Families
headline.print_headline: A Cruel Blow to American Families

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
